DOCNAME: CASE OF SEYİTHAN DEMIR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1+6-3-c;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant started his compulsory military service .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL conscripts , Mr PERSON and PERSON , informed their superiors and other soldiers that the applicant had made several improper comments to them .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON claimed that the applicant had shown him a map of GPE indicating how they were going to establish GPE and put up its flag and had also said that the ORG and soldiers were killing their people and innocent children . According to Mr PERSON , the applicant also stated that “ during target practice they can if they want shoot right on target but that they would not ” .
CARDINAL . Mr PERSON alleged that the applicant had kept telling him that they were going to establish GPE and that he had a commando physique and they should take him to the camps .
CARDINAL . On DATE the head of the military unit heard the applicant , Mr PERSON and PERSON , PERSON and PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicant maintained that he had never made such remarks and that it was nothing but lies and smears . He stated that he did not have any quarrel with the people who had accused him .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE , the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment with that court charging the applicant with the offence defined in section CARDINAL of LAW , namely , disseminating separatist propaganda .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a preparatory hearing at which it decided on procedural matters , namely issuing rogatory letters to various authorities in order to secure the applicant ’s and the ORG statements . The next hearing was fixed for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appeared before ORG . The indictment was read out to him . The applicant denied the accusations against him and claimed that Mr PERSON , with whom he had had an argument , was lying . He maintained that he had never uttered the words mentioned in the indictment . The record of the hearing noted that the applicant had requested to be exempted from the obligation to appear at the hearing ( duruşmadan vareste tutulma ) . The applicant was not represented by a lawyer .

CARDINAL . On various dates the rogatory courts heard evidence from PERSON , PERSON , PERSON PERSON and Mr Dere . In their statements , PERSON and Mr Dere both affirmed , inter alia , that they had not heard the applicant making the impugned remarks but had been informed of them through Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON .

CARDINAL . In his statement Mr PERSON claimed , inter alia , that the applicant had told him “ we have camps in the east . Let me take you to them . You have a commando physique ” . He stated that the applicant was smiling and it looked like a joke . However , he started to take his words seriously when he heard what the applicant had said to Mr PERSON and decided to complain about him to their hierarchical authorities .

CARDINAL . In his statement Mr PERSON claimed , inter alia , that on various occasions the applicant had told him “ NORP soldiers are traitors , they kill our people . ORG have killed our people and blame it on us . Before military service I was receiving instruction at a camp . ” He further claimed that the applicant was pointing at the eastern part of GPE on the map and saying “ We are going to divide GPE and establish GPE ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , CARDINAL May and DATE the first - instance court held hearings , in the absence of the applicant , during which the statements of the applicant and CARDINAL of the witnesses taken by way of rogatory letters were read out .
CARDINAL . During the trial the applicant was doing his military service in GPE .

CARDINAL . In the hearing held on DATE the statements of the other CARDINAL witnesses , taken by way of rogatory letters , were read out . The prosecutor did not ask for an additional investigation and read out his observations on the merits of the case . On DATE the court , on the basis of witness testimonies , considered that the applicant had disseminated separatist propaganda and convicted him as charged . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and to a heavy fine . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant hired a lawyer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer filed an appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the principal public prosecutor at ORG submitted his written opinion to that court . The prosecutor asked the court to dismiss the applicant ’s legal representative ’s appeal , in accordance with LAW , on the ground that it had been submitted out of time . This opinion was not communicated to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objections and upheld the judgment of the first - instance court . In its judgment the court stated , inter alia , that , having regard to the evidence and the conviction and the assessment of the first - instance court in line with the conclusions of its investigation , the applicant ’s conviction had been in accordance with the procedure and the law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the principal public prosecutor at ORG dismissed a request by the applicant ’s lawyer for rectification of ORG judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant started serving his prison sentence .
CARDINAL . The applicant paid the fine , in CARDINAL instalments , on DATE , DATE and on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . By an additional judgment , dated DATE , ORG , taking into account that section CARDINAL of Law no . ORG had been abolished pursuant to PERSON no . DATE , annulled the applicant ’s conviction and ordered his immediate release . On DATE the applicant was released .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure , in force at the material time , provided as follows :
“ CARDINAL . If the accused or his lawyer , who has a power of attorney in this respect , so requests , the court may exempt the accused from the obligation to be present during the hearing .
CARDINAL . NORP ... the accused shall be questioned by a judge in another judicial district , acting on rogatory letters , about the principal facts of the case .

CARDINAL . Even if the accused does not so request , if the accused has been remanded in custody or is serving a sentence for another crime , the trial court can decide that the accused shall be questioned by a judge in another judicial district , acting on rogatory letters .
CARDINAL . The public prosecutor and the accused ’s lawyer shall be notified of the date set for questioning . There is no obligation for them to be present during the questioning .
CARDINAL . The record of the questioning shall be read out at the hearing . ”
